title: Incognibro public accessibility: branding, SEO static files, and custom-domain readiness (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Rename all user-visible branding and document metadata to “Incognibro” so no old name appears in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/privacy/Header.tsx, the header brand text shows "Incognibro" (not "Privacy Shield").
In frontend/index.html, the <title> is updated to "Incognibro".
All other visible occurrences of the old app name are updated to "Incognibro" (e.g., any headings/labels that previously referenced the old name).
All user-facing text updated/added by this change is in English.

file_operations.description: Update the displayed brand name to “Incognibro” and replace any remaining old-name strings in user-visible header content (including image alt text) while keeping the existing non‑VPN disclaimer behavior intact.
Update the document <title> to “Incognibro” and ensure any other old-name metadata text is replaced with English Incognibro branding.
Audit and update any remaining user-visible occurrences of the old app name (if present) so the UI is consistently branded as “Incognibro” in English.

requirements.summary: Add SPA-friendly SEO and indexing readiness via standard static files and basic HTML metadata.
acceptanceCriteria: The app serves a robots.txt that allows crawling (no blanket disallow rules).
The app serves a sitemap.xml suitable for a single-page app (at minimum, includes the root URL entry).
frontend/index.html includes standard SEO metadata for the Incognibro app (at minimum: updated title alignment with Incognibro and a meta description).
All added metadata text is in English.

file_operations.description: Add robots.txt that allows crawling (no blanket disallow) and references the sitemap location for Incognibro.
Add a minimal sitemap.xml for a single-page app that includes at least the root URL entry; align the URL(s) with the project’s configurable canonical/public base URL strategy (see REQ-10).

Add standard SEO metadata in English suitable for a SPA (at minimum: meta description) and ensure the title aligns with “Incognibro”; include a canonical link strategy compatible with REQ-10’s configurable public base URL.
Create a small SEO helper hook to set/update document title and canonical/meta description at runtime for SPA navigation, using the configured public base URL (see REQ-10).
Wire the SEO metadata helper so it runs for the SPA (at least on initial load) and keeps Incognibro’s title/description/canonical consistent.

requirements.summary: Add custom-domain readiness documentation and frontend configuration for canonical/public base URL used by SEO artifacts.
acceptanceCriteria: Repository includes a human-readable setup guide describing how to point a custom domain to the app (DNS records and any IC-specific steps), written in English.
Frontend supports configuring the canonical/public base URL (so sitemap/canonical references can be correct when a custom domain is used).
Documentation explicitly notes that Google indexing is not immediate and depends on Google crawling after the site is publicly reachable.

file_operations.description: Add a central site configuration module that resolves the canonical/public base URL from a build-time environment variable (with a safe runtime fallback), to be used by SEO metadata and sitemap guidance.
Document the environment variable(s) needed to configure the canonical/public base URL for Incognibro (example values in English).

Create an English setup guide for mapping a custom domain to the deployed Internet Computer frontend assets, including required DNS records, any IC-specific steps, the canonical site URL to use for SEO, and an explicit note that Google indexing is not immediate and depends on crawling once the site is publicly reachable.

Align sitemap.xml guidance/content with the canonical/public base URL configuration approach described in frontend/src/config/site.ts and the custom-domain setup guide (ensure at least the root URL entry is present).
